name: Of the Holy Scriptures
description: The authority, sufficiency, and perspicuity of Holy Scripture as the rule of faith and life.

name: Of God and of the Holy Trinity
description: The being, attributes, and tri-personal nature of God: Father, Son, and Holy Spirit.

name: Of God's Eternal Decree
description: The eternal, wise, and holy counsel of God's will, including predestination and election.

name: Of Creation
description: God's work of creating the world and all things therein, especially man in His own image.

name: Of Providence
description: God's most holy, wise, and powerful preserving and governing all His creatures and all their actions.

name: Of the Fall, Sin, and Punishment
description: The fall of man, original sin, and the punishment thereof.

name: Of God's Covenant
description: The covenant of works and the covenant of grace. Note: the 1689 teaches one covenant of grace, while the WCF distinguishes two administrations.

name: Of Christ the Mediator
description: The person, natures, offices, and states of the Lord Jesus Christ as the only Mediator between God and man.

name: Of Free Will
description: The state of man's will in its various conditions: creation, fall, grace, and glory.

name: Of Effectual Calling
description: The work of God's Spirit in effectually calling sinners and uniting them to Christ by faith.

name: Of Justification
description: God's free pardon of sin and acceptance of sinners as righteous through the imputed righteousness of Christ, received by faith alone.

name: Of Adoption
description: The privilege of being received into the number and enjoying the liberties of the sons of God.

name: Of Sanctification
description: The renewal of the whole person after the image of God, enabling believers to die more unto sin and live more unto righteousness.

name: Of Saving Faith
description: The nature of saving faith as receiving and resting on Christ for salvation.

name: Of Repentance unto Life
description: The evangelical grace of repentance unto life and the forgiveness of sins.

name: Of Good Works
description: Good works as the fruit of faith and obedience to God's commands.

name: Of Perseverance of the Saints
description: The perseverance of true believers in the state of grace to the end.

name: Of Assurance of Grace and Salvation
description: The grounds and means of assurance of salvation.

name: Of the Law of God
description: The moral law as the rule of obedience for all men and its uses under the covenant of grace.

name: Of the Gospel
description: The gospel of grace and its extent. This chapter appears in both the Savoy Declaration and the 1689 Confession but has no WCF counterpart.

name: Of Christian Liberty
description: The freedom of believers under the gospel and liberty of conscience.

name: Of Religious Worship and the Sabbath
description: The acceptable way of worshipping God and the sanctification of the Lord's Day.

name: Of Lawful Oaths and Vows
description: The right use of lawful oaths and vows.

name: Of the Civil Magistrate
description: The authority and duties of the civil magistrate in relation to the church.

name: Of Marriage
description: The institution, purposes, and regulation of marriage.

name: Of the Church and the Communion of Saints
description: The visible and invisible church, its Head the Lord Jesus Christ, and the fellowship of believers. The 1689 has a significantly expanded ecclesiology.

name: Of the Sacraments, Baptism, and the Lord's Supper
description: The sacraments, baptism, and the Lord's Supper. Key divergence: the 1689 teaches believer's baptism only, while the WCF includes infant baptism.

name: Of Church Government
description: Church censures and governance. The WCF teaches presbyterian government with synods and councils; the 1689 omits these chapters (congregationalist polity).

name: Death, Resurrection, and Last Judgment
description: The state of men after death, the resurrection of the body, and the final judgment at the last day.
